property.caption: Object Entity
property.description: The entity of the ArcGIS Objects.

property.caption: XPath Constraint
property.description: (Not applicable when using Get Objects Microflow) The XPath constraint on the objects.

property.caption: Object ID
property.description: The unique ObjectID attribute of the GIS Object. Used for zooming behavior when dataview context object is an ArcGIS Object. Should corresponds with 'ArcGIS Identifier Name' setting.

property.caption: ArcGIS Identifier Name
property.description: The name of the GIS attribute to use for querying ArcGIS and retrieving objects. Default is 'OBJECTID'

property.caption: Center Coordinates
property.description: The attribute to store the coordinates of the center of the GIS object in. Used especially for zooming in listen-to-grid scenario.

property.caption: Color Attribute
property.description: (Applicable on QueryLayer only) The attribute to use in the QueryLayer to overrule the color coming from ArcGIS. Comma separated RGB - 255,0,0 for red - is expected.

property.caption: Geometry Type
property.description: The attribute to store the geometry type in. This is used to query the correct ArcGIS layer if multiple layers with different Geometry Types are used.

property.caption: Base Default Map URL
property.description: The URL of the default base map to load.

property.caption: Base Satellite Map URL
property.description: The URL of the satellite base map to load.

property.caption: Spatial Reference
property.description: The spatial reference of a map, layer, or inputs to and outputs from a task. Each projected and geographic coordinate system is defined by either a well-known ID (WKID) or a definition string (WKT). Note that versions prior to ArcGIS 10 only wkid was supported.

property.caption: Show All Objects
property.description: When set to true all objects of the Layer will be shown. When set to false the widget will try only to plot only the objects that are retrieved by XPath, DataSource Microflow, or in case of a ListenToGrid, the Context DataGrid object.

property.caption: Enable Legend
property.description: This decides whether a legend is available for the plotted layers. An extra menu-item will be added in the accordeon menu.

property.caption: Enable Toggling Layers
property.description: This decides whether an end user will be available to toggle layer visibility. An extra menu-item will be added in the accordeon menu.

property.caption: Enable Search
property.description: Whether a Search Bar will be added to the map to search for and zoom to a typed in address.

property.caption: Start SublayerList Collapsed
property.description: This decides whether the list of toggable visible sublayers opens on startup.

property.caption: Height
property.description: The map's height in pixels.

property.caption: Width
property.description: The map's width in pixels.

property.caption: Custom Color
property.description: The hexadecimal color which will be used for styling the border of the map and the hover on accordion menu with Layers and SubLayers.

property.caption: Selected Color
property.description: The hexadecimal color which will be used for the active pane in the right accordion menu.

property.caption: Default Y
property.description: Default Y value for the map to start at.

property.caption: Default X
property.description: Default X for the map to start at.

property.caption: Default Zoom Level
property.description: The zoom level used when displaying a map only.

property.caption: Object Zoom Level
property.description: The zoom level used when focussing on an object.

property.caption: Layer Definitions
property.description: Add one or multiple layers to plot on the basemap.

property.caption: Layer Server Type
property.description: Determines which server type to use for the layers.

property.caption: Layer URL
property.description: The URL of the layer.

property.caption: Layer Name
property.description: The name of the layer to appear in the toggle layers pane.

property.caption: Visible Layer Indexes
property.description: (MapLayer only) The indexes, concatenated and separated with a comma, of the Layers to show on the basemap. So, if you want to show layers 2 and 3, add 2, 3 here.

property.caption: Start Layer Ticked
property.description: If set to 'Yes' the layer starts with the layer ticked, hence visible.

property.caption: Feature Layer ID
property.description: (FeatureLayer only) The ID of the FeatureLayer.

property.caption: Query Layer
property.description: (FeatureLayer only) Set this boolean to true to let the widget check this layer for retrieving the arcgis objects and setting the extent. Preferably set only 1 layer to Yes

property.caption: Show Attribution
property.description: Whether to show the attribution (who contributed to the map ESRI, Nasa, Kadaster, etc) of the Layer or not.

property.caption: Layer Opacity
property.description: (FeatureLayer only) Adjust the opacity of the objects plotted on the map. 1.0 is fully opaque, 0.0 is fully transparent. For polyons typically use 0.5.

property.caption: Layer Geometry Type
property.description: Based on this attribute the correct Layer will be queried for pop-up information.

property.caption: Enable Custom Styling
property.description: (Only supported for point and polygon QueryLayers) Whether to overrule styling for the object in the layer which has 'Query Layer' set to 'Yes'.

property.caption: Color Labeling
property.description: (QueryLayer only) Add labels to the different colors of the objects.

property.caption: Feature Color
property.description: (QueryLayer only) the RGB color of the object as found in the Color Attribute.

property.caption: Feature Label
property.description: (QueryLayer only) The label for the symbol of this specific RGB color.

property.caption: Default Color
property.description: The default color for all objects in the Query Layer that are not stored in Mendix.

property.caption: Default Label
property.description: The default label for all objects in the Query Layer that are not stored in Mendix.

property.caption: Marker Symbol
property.description: (QueryLayer only) Adjust the type of marker being placed on the map. Will overrule what is set in ArcGIS itself for the markers.

property.caption: Attributes
property.description: Add one or multiple attributes which are to be retrieved on click of a point and shown in infowindow popup..

property.caption: Name
property.description: The name of the attribute in the layer. Should be an exact match, because layer will be queried for this attribute.

property.caption: Label
property.description: The label to appear in the infowindow popup, next to the value.

property.caption: Is Title
property.description: Whether the attribute is to be used as the title or not. Only set one of the attributes to Yes!

property.caption: On Click Microflow
property.description: Microflow that will be executed when you click on the infowindow button. Takes the entity of the Objects as input parameter

property.caption: On Click Button Label
property.description: The label of the button to appear in the infowindow.

property.caption: On Click Button Class
property.description: The classes on the button to appear in the infowindow. By default mendix default classes are added. Those can be stripped and/or your own class added.

property.caption: Get Objects Microflow
property.description: Microflow to retrieve all objects which should be visible on the ArcGIS Map.

property.caption: Get Objects Entity
property.description: The entity which will be used as inputparameter for Get Objects Microflow.

property.caption: Get HostName Microflow
property.description: Microflow which should be used to retrieve the HostName, preferably stored in an application constant. Needs the constant as a String outputparameter..

property.caption: Get FeatureServerName Microflow
property.description: Microflow which should be used to retrieve the FeatureServerName, preferably stored in an application constant. Needs the constant as a String outputparameter. If not chosen, the FeatureServer name of the Layer Objects will be chosen.

property.caption: Logging
property.description:
For debugging purposes.
If set to true the widget will add a console.dir (whole object) and console.log (coordinates) for every object retrieved from the database. The results can be checked in the browser itself in the console tab.
